People working there were all super nice, always smiling, friendly, with great sense of humor. Very relaxed atmosphere, at the same time always professional. Hugo was very well balanced 😉👌
I would certainly recommend and would eat there again.

Good food, quick service! I think it's a bit expensive but the quality might make up for it! With 2 we spent 80 for 1 main course and a beer per person.

Good food. Beautiful place.
The service is very nice and polite...
but undestaffed, even on a Friday night. Too much wait.
They must be more staffed, cause only 2 staff for a whole bar restaurant is simply not enough to hope people come again. Specially when it comes to deal with the high price of the menu. Last things : there are about more than 10 big TV, but we used to see only the same advertising in loop, so booooring for a Friday night... Absolutely NO AMBIANCE. Why don't you broadcast some sport match, or video music, ...or ANYTHING ELSE all days. This bar is a beautiful jewel, but not polish.

On a Saturday night before a movie we wanted to get burgers and wings. We arrived at 7:10 pm, at 8:30 pm our food had still not arrived. We had to cancel the order because the film was about to start. Hungry and disappointed. Lift your game!
Great atmosphere, very attentive and nice service. To recommend! We'd love to come back :)

The place is nice and convenient in a shopping mall. We love the running sushi and the staff is usually very nice! You can order what you like on the tablet but very rarely they have a lot of options on the running band, which is unfortunate. Because we’d surely try different things if we’d see it running in front of our noses. But we do keep coming back, even though it is a bit pricey and for two adults and two kids, you have to count on spending between 120-160 fr.

Good spot to eat sushi. Order on tablet or per staff you can sit at the conveyer belt if wanted. Some stuff just stays on the conveyer belt a bit too long if its not a popular dish. + the sake is kind of overpriced for the quantities depending on which sake you get.

I never wrote a review about any restaurant but the awful treatment I received is worth to do it.

The food is good and the ambience was nice, but I just can say that they have such a terrible Staff, I was treated with such an arrogant and disrespectful behaviour by two of the ladies who work there and were at that moment serving.

I would completely not recommend just because how they made me feel.
Such a beautiful and accommodating place for a sushi experience…
A bit pricy but very good and very fresh sushi. Just a great experience

Nothing like japanese ramen. Tasteless, a lot of ginger, corns and egg was not ramen style just simple boiled. Sitting places not comfortable. The only think i like was the service. The girl who was serving was always smiling, very welcoming.

Good kimchi, delicious Gyoza, great choice of Ramen, Soba and Udon with different broths.

The service is friendly and the atmosphere as well as the food feels authentic enough for being in a bustling, modern shopping mall.

Definitely a good place for some quick eats or a chill time with some company.
I am quite sad after eating there, I’d rather eat instant ramen. Sushi was also bad and the rice was overcooked. Gyoza were okay, but tasted as if bought frozen from the Store

Ordered the char sew ramen. The char sui was straight out of Jamie Oliver's recipe book (aka just boiled bland prork).
The miso base was way too salty and the ramen was clumped together and raw. For what you get this place is way overpriced and way to low quality.
Japanese-style Ramen restaurant located in the Westside mall. You can select four different kinds of broth and different types of noodles. Decent quality and price. Fast and friendly service.
Dr geilscht Klub from Bärn✌️
I really like this place.  Had a great steak (Rind Entrecote) and salad here today for lunch. 25 Franks well spent. The staff is very friendly. Food is Keto friendly.
So cool
Very great gentleman in the kitchen. Although closed from 8 p.m. he made 2 menus. Bravo, that's service.
Restaurant with children's play area. The prices are not very high but sometimes it is difficult to find a place to eat seated because there are so many people!
Serve very loudly according to the menu, see photo, it's a shame

Being from Turkey, clear “do not go”!
The veal kebap smells weird including pork and baklava has no pistachio taste. You wont know whether you eat what you paid..
When we warned the owner kindly, they reacted very rude and teasingly… No customer orientation at all.. had to leave my first google maps review…

Excellent food , amazing customer service , Best prices around ,

I totally recommend!!!
Best Döner I’ve ever had! Friendly staff! Many thanks Ali and team!
The portion of the pacha kebab was too small . The taste was great.

Went to this place maybe 4 times during my day trip to Bern(lunch, early dinner, late dinner, lunch). Portions were good, ingredients were very fresh, price was more than reasonable than other places around, overall  👍👍 I guess the employees are quite free spirited and can tick off some people in their reviews, I did like them alot!

5/5 for Asian food. Amazing atmosphere at Nooch Asian Kitchen Bern Westside. The ambiance is vibrant and inviting, perfect for a night out. Be sure to make a reservation to ensure you get a spot. We had a fantastic meal, trying a variety of dishes. The sweet potato fries were crispy and delicious, the steamed buns were soft and flavorful, and the dumplings were perfectly cooked. The stir-fried noodles were fresh and had a great mix of flavors. The beer complemented the meal perfectly. However, the sushi prices surprised us—they were quite high, so we opted not to try them this time. Highly recommend this place for its excellent service and delicious Asian cuisine. Would definitely come back!

Nice place with a unique style and decoration. Food is good to great and service is excellent.
Slightly overpriced but definitely worth a visit.
Great service.. yummy food.. love there home-made ice tea too, so refreshing.. never disappointed in nooch so far.. 😊
Delicious Thai food in a beautiful environment. However, the green curry was average. In general, it’s an excellent place to dine. Get your reservation; it’s pretty busy every day.

Nice restaurant, but The rice in the sushi was
not the best, I wouldn't recommend them. The noodles were really tasty though. Service was excellent.
Absolutely fantastic food, authentic Italian specialties, and a great wine list. Their Vitello tonnato is off this world. Service is top-notch and very friendly.

We celebrated kid's birthday here, was very nice and tasty. Good recommendations from the waitress, nice service. A dessert with a candle from the restaurant for the birthday kid. Pleasant atmosphere and not too many people in the evening.
Awesome service and great pizza. Staff was very helpful. Highly recommended!

I had a very disappointing experience at this restaurant. Our group of ten, all of African descent, visited, with six of us ordering coffee while the other two were waiting for their orders. Despite this, the waitress was consistently hostile and informed us that we couldn't sit there without everyone ordering. Her attitude felt discriminatory and made the entire visit unpleasant. It's disheartening to encounter such treatment, and it's unlikely we'll return. Customer service should be welcoming to everyone, regardless of race or background.

I have been in Switzerland a few times, and everytime i have to stop by Piazza.
The last time I was there was actually a few weeks ago and the food was amazing! Not only was it delicious but what I loved was that the restaurant had a wide range of things to choose, such as vegetarian, and being a picky eater like me I enjoyed everything. The staff was very precise and very very kind which I loved and you definitely feel very welcomed when you’re there. Furthermore, the interior of the restaurant is very special and very cozy and artistic, which I loved.
If you’re visiting Bern and are thinking of having a tasty meal, Piazza is the place for you!

I have travelled the world extensively over 40 years. I ate at all restaurants ranging from pop & mom’s to Michelin three stars. This is my honest review of the restaurant Spiga on the westside service area of Bern region. I had penne all’amatricianna and a side salad. It was decent but nothing to write home about.
Nice pizzas, decent wine as well. It's quick. t's self-service with pickup, the athmosphere is not great, plain/boring. For 2 pizzas and 2 glasses of wine we spent 58
the worst pasta I have ever eaten in my life. I order salmon tagliatelle, there was more fresh chives than salmon.
Generally pizzas are good but calzone is not baked through, egg is raw with transparent glibberish, after multiple times of complaining they dont seem to care changing the oven time in receipe.

This poor fella of a spicy salami pizza cost me 20 franc.
The dough, cheese had no taste.
Tomato sauce was barely even present.
Everything was literally just thrown ontop of the dough, when cut theres literally a whole piece with no toppings.
You had my attention with the price, making me expect premium ingredients.
But instead you lost my trust.
Place is spotless. Customer service is great! Food is satisfying!
Visiting from Canada and came upon this waffle place.  My Green smoothie was a perfect treat.  Great atmosphere and impeccable customer service from the friendly staff😁

Thanks 😊 for eat
We are best food 🙈🌯🌯
i came to visit switzerland from canada and stopped by waffle star they have amazing service! the employees are so nice and friendly. Definitely recommend coming here 10/10! 😁
Super tasty, I liked it !

I was there on Sunday morning. The employee was very nice and served me courteously. The coffee was excellent and I had the tomato mozzarella sandwich, which was fresh and tasted delicious. Feel free to try out more things on your next visit

It’s great to grab a nice coffee while doing some shopping here. I do wish they had ice coffee year round here, but even so they do have some tasty, satisfying coffee’s. It’s always clean and staff are friendly and the seating is cozy.
Music in cafe could be better...just for atmosphere need another music😕🙏

Overall a decent coffee shop nothing special, a bit understaffed and there are no tissues other than the single one offered which can be a bit annoying but overall it’s a good restaurant with good food. They also have vegan options (chicken that’s not really chicken).
Great service, great food! Amazing coffee

I used to buy Subway in westside and recently they told me that the grams of the meat are less than before. I ordered 3 sandwiches with the rind Fleisch and it was really disappointing in every bite! They put so little. I mean we understand that all the ingredients was expensive but it doesnt mean they will not satisfy their customer. They can increase the price but give the same quantity & quality of the food. We pay!!! And also the crew who are working are so untidy using the same gloves to the food after cleaning and touching the rag. So bad!
The guy who served me was very agreeable, thank you
Food is always fantastic and the staff are always friendly.
i just love it, this is not an ad, btw

Stefan and Roberto were very personable, they served me and my colleague. They were very friendly and talked respectfully, which I really appreciate. The food was also very tasty and thanks to the staff's recommendation, my sandwich improved again! Very happy😁

NOT WORTH IT to pay the price for the burrito con Res. It was basically a tortilla with a lot of lettuce, sauce,a bit of paprika and carrot (really big pieces and also not cooked) and some pieces of beef. Completely lack of that desired mexican flavour, i was thinking that it could be spicy but actually not. The presentation and the package were fine. But the main product makes you feel completely dissapointed. As i order for take away the attention on the payment and the look of the place is really nice but further than that it will be a definitely no for me.
Not reccommended
The best mexican food in switzerland. I love it. Go there, its so worth it.

We ordered snack plate for 2 witch was okay but nothing special and fajitas chicken with pineapples witch was only with 2 small pineapple pieces.Actually i think its too expensive for what you get. Will not come back.
Amazing food and really warm and good hosts. Would revisit for sure 😊🫶🏼

The food and price were both good. Definitely want to re-visit for that. And the glass was super cute.
However, it’s located in underground floor so felt kinda gloomy. And also Before you enter, you have to wait for the waiters to guide you but they take so long time. One family behind us got tired of waiting and just left.
Beautiful postcards for cheap!
The best place ever with top Service.
Staff were rude and unwelcoming.

THE BEST team, the great menu offers, fine salad, dessert, great opening hours, extraordinarily friendly service, flexible conditions, everything works, top service, fast process, harmony reigns on the terrace, everything is clean, customers are kings, I'm very lucky to have that You can really enjoy it. Thank you very much, dear Migro Restaurant Team, you've been the best.

Perfect place for a breakfast or lunch break. A large selection of food and drinks so there should be something for everyone. There are many seating options and parking spaces available. Friendly and nice staff. There are sanitary facilities. In the same building there is also a shop with a large selection.

I had an ice cream, it was expired. I went to the employee and got a cheaper one which cost 1.60 and mine cost 2.00. I only got 20 centimes back, and the employee never said sorry. she was very cheeky. Please fire her Migros team.

Good aperitif bar in midsummer, nice and cool inside because it's air-conditioned, there are so-called "babies" gin and tonic and Bachardi Cola for a good price, so it doesn't always have to be beer. Gin Gin 👍

read newspaper

The staff were incredibly friendly and accommodating, which added to the enjoyment of the movie night. However, I have to dock one star because the popcorn wasn't super fresh, and for many moviegoers, that's an essential part of the experience! 😅 Despite the popcorn hiccup, I would definitely recommend Pathé Cinema for a pleasant movie-watching experience in Bern.
It's really a modern and comfortable Cinema but they always Show horror Films late at night so around 23 and 23:30. It would be Nice if the Horror Films Shows at 20 or 20:30.

The good stuff: No breaks during screenings, cheap parking. The bad: the audio sounds terrible and the picture follows suit. The ugly: my god this cinema looks run down. Ugly looking carpets, seats and just poor state of it all. But at least the shop is looking shiny... So yes, i love the fact that parking is much cheaper and there aren't any breaks unlike other places but my god im there for the movie and in that department, Pathe gets 0.5/5 stars.

Good Vibes and Real Cinema Feelings! Good Job =)

If you going there, take some salted Jumbo Popcorn! You will like it! 😉

I was looking forward to enjoying the full cinema experience with Oppenheimer. There was no popcorn nothin, just overpriced pringles and a very dirty theater. Moreover the air conditioning wasn't working properly/ only for a few minutes, even though it was a cool summer day. And as a cherry on top, the screen had green pixels. During a 3h screening without pause not the experience I was looking for with respect to the price I payed.

Really not a good wellness place. Facilities downstairs are next to kids slides, super noisy and only burgers/nuggets with chips. They dont let you read tablet/phone (even if using as kindle) in wellness area, wellness itself was quite nice just overal location and vibe not good at all. Definately NOT going back to this place.

I recently visited Bernaqua for the sauna and spa experience. Having visited spas across Europe for over two decades, I must say this was by far the worst experience I've had. One positive note is that the facility is spotlessly clean. However, all other aspects were disappointing.

Firstly, the design and materials of the building are very unwelcoming. Hard surfaces reflect all sounds, including children, breathing, walking, and cleaning equipment, which is constantly in use. Even at distances of 20-30 meters, you hear everything. It results in a constant barrage of indistinct sounds that permeate even the saunas. The sleep/silent room is also plagued by the sound of the nearby highway, coupled with ventilation noise, and it is uncomfortably cold. Additionally, it looks like a garage filled with mismatched furniture.

Moreover, the signage is very confusing. Upon entry, you're greeted by a cacophony of screaming children, and due to the poor acoustic design, it is quite painful on the ears. There seems to be a separate spa dressing room, but it's only for members. As a result, you end up walking a significant distance to find an empty dressing room, only to realize you need to wear bathing clothes to access the sauna area. Finding the showers is another challenge, as you must pass two saunas and follow confusing signage. It appears forbidden to use soap in some showers, but later on, you discover another shower area where soap use is presumably allowed.

The shower water seems full of chlorine. My eyes hurt like when i was diving in school pool with open eyes but no goggles. And the lighting is harsh white LED, directly in your face. The overall aesthetic feels like a mix of Soviet and East German influences, devoid of any understanding of rich Russian or European sauna culture. Despite the use of high-end materials, the design lacks coherence. For example, one sauna features a “catwalk” that squeaks and is poorly lit, making you feel uncomfortable under the dim white LED light while others stare at you. I normally don't mind being naked in public spaces, but this place made me feel very self-conscious and uncomfortable.

Some vending machines with dry salads and no cutlery to top it off.

I believe some plants, wooden room dividers, and a separate dressing room could significantly improve the atmosphere. It needs a touch of warmth and thoughtful design. As it stands, I left with more stress and less money. And I am not typically a complaining type.

Save your time and money and go somewhere else to recharge. If you really must go I highly recommend you take earplugs and shades/sleep masks with you.

It is an amazing place with tons of options for both kids and adults. There’s fresh water and saline water pools, warm (30-35c) or cold (18c) options. Lots of play toys for everyone, including a huge inflated floating island and a massive tube slide that’s 3 stories tall. The place is extremely clean and people are just so nice and courteous. We went while on vacation in Bern and the kids just needed a nice fun break from sightseeing.
Yes, they sell swimsuits right there for those that didn’t think to pack one on a December trip to Switzerland :)
Overall highly recommend the place for a fun relaxing non-touristy activity especially for the kids!

It’s ok and clean because it’s quite new. It’s much smaller than alpamare in pfäffikon. This one has three slides and a wild water slide. Alpamare has at least twice as many, more outdoor pools, a wave pool etc. so alpamare is a lot more fun than this one. But this one is nice for what it is. Also, when we were there, it felt really full and we had to wait nearly 15min to go down a slide. When we left (attendance was still increasing), the website showed 60% full. But it really felt like 100% full already
Had a wonderful time with the kids. The staff is so friendly and well intentioned. Very diverse and balanced water park mixing leisure and relaxation to the perfection.

Its also nice for introverts who fear talking to the cashier who is simply doing their job. Thats why you should always be happy going to Mcdonalds and always order a happy meal. haahahaha

Spacious and modern design. On the downside since the seating area is shared with 4 other restaurants you have to go there either really early or late otherwise you wont find a space to sit easily. Also there are no electronical systems to order, only the service station.

Really good garage. Ricci, the friendly mechanic, is easy to communicate with, gives great advice, and speaks English really well. He listens attentively to your needs, asks lots of questions, and finds a suitable solution for you, that will not put a big dent in your wallet. He has saved me lots of money, and kept my car running and passing safety inspections numerous times. I've been to quite a few garages in Bern, and this is by far the best one. Can't recommend it enough.
I use this station to clean my car with the vacuum cleaner. It cost 1 chf for 4 minutes. Usually it's not crowded.
Not too big but a very nice petrol the stuff are just a little overpriced
Best place for washing car!
Fruits sometimes in horrible condition.
There was a police during a schulfest Currently there are three police cars This is a crazy school
Was a student there for 5 years. Worst time I've had. It was being bullied, the teachers knew it and didn't do anything, just watched.
As a student I have to say that this school is bad, sorry but
A few years ago a very good, new schoolhouse near the forest.
Proud students
I bought a jacket last year and the cover where you could tie the jacket tighter fell off. Today I was satisfied more than expected. I am a loyal customer of the Marc O'Polo brand!
Great clothing store with friendly staff
Top Personal
Super

Super bad shop! No greeting, no farewell. As a customer you feel out of place. The MA today, completely bored and pissed off that a customer wanders in at 5:20 p.m. It's not worth visiting your place, it's better to shop online.

Unsatisfied experience at Mobilezone

I recently had an extremely unsatisfactory experience at Mobilezone. I originally planned to get a mobile phone subscription, but the advice I received left a bitter aftertaste.

The salesperson suggested changing my internet provider from UPC to Sunrise as my promotion with UPC was expiring. He assured me that this would save me the 54 CHF for the cell phone deposit. He also promised me “free” headphones and a phone case for half the price. I confidently accepted this offer.

However, after I contacted UPC back home, they offered to extend the promotion for another 2 years, which was clearly a better offer than Sunrise's. When I tried to cancel the migration, the salesperson said he would discuss it with his colleague and call me back the next day. That callback never came.

Frustrated by the lack of communication, I went back to the store to ask. The seller's response was simply disappointing: "Been busy." When I tried to cancel the migration again, I was suddenly charged a fee of 150 CHF. I was informed that if I wanted to cancel this fee would be applied to the supposedly "free" headphones, phone case and cell phone.

Ultimately, I was forced to contact Sunrise directly to cancel the migration, which involved additional time and inconvenience. This experience not only cost me money, but also valuable time and nerves. I am extremely disappointed by the lack of transparency and unfair treatment by Mobilezone.
Top customer service! I have been visiting this branch for years. Questions are answered competently and friendly. I can recommend this branch 100%.

So yes, i love the fact that parking is much cheaper and there aren't any breaks unlike other places but my god im there for the movie and in that department, Pathe gets 0.5/5 stars.

Good Vibes and Real Cinema Feelings! Good Job =)

If you going there, take some salted Jumbo Popcorn! You will like it! 😉

I was looking forward to enjoying the full cinema experience with Oppenheimer. There was no popcorn nothin, just overpriced pringles and a very dirty theater. Moreover the air conditioning wasn't working properly/ only for a few minutes, even though it was a cool summer day. And as a cherry on top, the screen had green pixels. During a 3h screening without pause not the experience I was looking for with respect to the price I payed.

Really not a good wellness place. Facilities downstairs are next to kids slides, super noisy and only burgers/nuggets with chips. They dont let you read tablet/phone (even if using as kindle) in wellness area, wellness itself was quite nice just overal location and vibe not good at all. Definately NOT going back to this place.

I recently visited Bernaqua for the sauna and spa experience. Having visited spas across Europe for over two decades, I must say this was by far the worst experience I've had. One positive note is that the facility is spotlessly clean. However, all other aspects were disappointing.

Firstly, the design and materials of the building are very unwelcoming. Hard surfaces reflect all sounds, including children, breathing, walking, and cleaning equipment, which is constantly in use. Even at distances of 20-30 meters, you hear everything. It results in a constant barrage of indistinct sounds that permeate even the saunas. The sleep/silent room is also plagued by the sound of the nearby highway, coupled with ventilation noise, and it is uncomfortably cold. Additionally, it looks like a garage filled with mismatched furniture.

Moreover, the signage is very confusing. Upon entry, you're greeted by a cacophony of screaming children, and due to the poor acoustic design, it is quite painful on the ears. There seems to be a separate spa dressing room, but it's only for members. As a result, you end up walking a significant distance to find an empty dressing room, only to realize you need to wear bathing clothes to access the sauna area. Finding the showers is another challenge, as you must pass two saunas and follow confusing signage. It appears forbidden to use soap in some showers, but later on, you discover another shower area where soap use is presumably allowed.

The shower water seems full of chlorine. My eyes hurt like when i was diving in school pool with open eyes but no goggles. And the lighting is harsh white LED, directly in your face. The overall aesthetic feels like a mix of Soviet and East German influences, devoid of any understanding of rich Russian or European sauna culture. Despite the use of high-end materials, the design lacks coherence. For example, one sauna features a “catwalk” that squeaks and is poorly lit, making you feel uncomfortable under the dim white LED light while others stare at you. I normally don't mind being naked in public spaces, but this place made me feel very self-conscious and uncomfortable.

Some vending machines with dry salads and no cutlery to top it off.

I believe some plants, wooden room dividers, and a separate dressing room could significantly improve the atmosphere. It needs a touch of warmth and thoughtful design. As it stands, I left with more stress and less money. And I am not typically a complaining type.

Save your time and money and go somewhere else to recharge. If you really must go I highly recommend you take earplugs and shades/sleep masks with you.

It is an amazing place with tons of options for both kids and adults. There’s fresh water and saline water pools, warm (30-35c) or cold (18c) options. Lots of play toys for everyone, including a huge inflated floating island and a massive tube slide that’s 3 stories tall. The place is extremely clean and people are just so nice and courteous. We went while on vacation in Bern and the kids just needed a nice fun break from sightseeing.
Yes, they sell swimsuits right there for those that didn’t think to pack one on a December trip to Switzerland :)
Overall highly recommend the place for a fun relaxing non-touristy activity especially for the kids!

It’s ok and clean because it’s quite new. It’s much smaller than alpamare in pfäffikon. This one has three slides and a wild water slide. Alpamare has at least twice as many, more outdoor pools, a wave pool etc. so alpamare is a lot more fun than this one. But this one is nice for what it is. Also, when we were there, it felt really full and we had to wait nearly 15min to go down a slide. When we left (attendance was still increasing), the website showed 60% full. But it really felt like 100% full already
Had a wonderful time with the kids. The staff is so friendly and well intentioned. Very diverse and balanced water park mixing leisure and relaxation to the perfection.

Best service at table you dont need to order you just need to sit and they serve you like a proper restaurant PERFECT. A great way to make lazy people more lazy. i am just kidding. Its also nice for introverts who fear talking to the cashier who is simply doing their job. Thats why you should always be happy going to Mcdonalds and always order a happy meal. haahahaha

I was tired and hungry.
This was the reason I ate there.
Only.

Spacious and modern design. On the downside since the seating area is shared with 4 other restaurants you have to go there either really early or late otherwise you wont find a space to sit easily. Also there are no electronical systems to order, only the service station.
It's plastic food... no need to explain.

We arw regular visitors in Westside Bern , sometimes we stop by to take a coffee or a dessert at McCafé Westside.. to be honest from all the McCafés from the region this is the best one and it deserves  better review and positive opinions..The young lady taking care of McCafé is Cami and she is always smiling and working non stop . always checking and taking the orders of all the clients quiet fast and on time ...Thank you for  that great service and for the manager David ...not even he is a professional and honest manager he also do care about the environment and the good service of his staff...

Super bad shop! No greeting, no farewell. As a customer you feel out of place. The MA today, completely bored and pissed off that a customer wanders in at 5:20 p.m. It's not worth visiting your place, it's better to shop online.

Unsatisfied experience at Mobilezone

I recently had an extremely unsatisfactory experience at Mobilezone. I originally planned to get a mobile phone subscription, but the advice I received left a bitter aftertaste.

The salesperson suggested changing my internet provider from UPC to Sunrise as my promotion with UPC was expiring. He assured me that this would save me the 54 CHF for the cell phone deposit. He also promised me “free” headphones and a phone case for half the price. I confidently accepted this offer.

However, after I contacted UPC back home, they offered to extend the promotion for another 2 years, which was clearly a better offer than Sunrise's. When I tried to cancel the migration, the salesperson said he would discuss it with his colleague and call me back the next day. That callback never came.

Frustrated by the lack of communication, I went back to the store to ask. The seller's response was simply disappointing: "Been busy." When I tried to cancel the migration again, I was suddenly charged a fee of 150 CHF. I was informed that if I wanted to cancel this fee would be applied to the supposedly "free" headphones, phone case and cell phone.

Ultimately, I was forced to contact Sunrise directly to cancel the migration, which involved additional time and inconvenience. This experience not only cost me money, but also valuable time and nerves. I am extremely disappointed by the lack of transparency and unfair treatment by Mobilezone.
Top customer service! I have been visiting this branch for years. Questions are answered competently and friendly. I can recommend this branch 100%.

reviews.text:
This was a great stay as we were traveling through Switzerland on our way to France.
Amazing location, as the train station is right outside the door, and there is direct access to the mall for eating and shopping. The room was very nice and clean, and the staff are super friendly!

The staff is so nice and good
Place is nice and having a connected mall and water park❤️
And the station is in front of the hotel
And water park is my favourite ❤️ and u will get free access to from hotel side

We recently stayed at the Holiday Inn Bern-Westside, and found the experience to be extremely positive. The room was great, and we had the added perk of a view of the mountains in the distance. Extra conveniences included access to the next door mall and public transportation to the city, right out the front door of the hotel!

The biggest reason to stay here is the
staff! They were extremely helpful and friendly. Thank you!

Very Great Mall Location including access to public transport. Hotel staff will sign you up for free Bus rides etc.
Staff was Extremely friendly.

Nothing really to fault. Easy location to drive to. Ample parking space under hotel. Excellent hotel staff service, all with a freindly face and pleasent to speak with. Nice hotel and huge bonus having the train station outside which comes with a pass from the hotel for free travel into Bern and avoid traffic and parking there. Perfect.

Unsatisfied experience at Mobilezone

I recently had an extremely unsatisfactory experience at Mobilezone. I originally planned to get a mobile phone subscription, but the advice I received left a bitter aftertaste.

The salesperson suggested changing my internet provider from UPC to Sunrise as my promotion with UPC was expiring. He assured me that this would save me the 54 CHF for the cell phone deposit. He also promised me “free” headphones and a phone case for half the price. I confidently accepted this offer.

However, after I contacted UPC back home, they offered to extend the promotion for another 2 years, which was clearly a better offer than Sunrise's. When I tried to cancel the migration, the salesperson said he would discuss it with his colleague and call me back the next day. That callback never came.

Frustrated by the lack of communication, I went back to the store to ask. The seller's response was simply disappointing: "Been busy." When I tried to cancel the migration again, I was suddenly charged a fee of 150 CHF. I was informed that if I wanted to cancel this fee would be applied to the supposedly "free" headphones, phone case and cell phone.

Ultimately, I was forced to contact Sunrise directly to cancel the migration, which involved additional time and inconvenience. This experience not only cost me money, but also valuable time and nerves. I am extremely disappointed by the lack of transparency and unfair treatment by Mobilezone.
Top customer service! I have been visiting this branch for years. Questions are answered competently and friendly. I can recommend this branch 100%.

Really not a good wellness place. Facilities downstairs are next to kids slides, super noisy and only burgers/nuggets with chips. They dont let you read tablet/phone (even if using as kindle) in wellness area, wellness itself was quite nice just overal location and vibe not good at all. Definately NOT going back to this place.

I recently visited Bernaqua for the sauna and spa experience. Having visited spas across Europe for over two decades, I must say this was by far the worst experience I've had. One positive note is that the facility is spotlessly clean. However, all other aspects were disappointing.

Firstly, the design and materials of the building are very unwelcoming. Hard surfaces reflect all sounds, including children, breathing, walking, and cleaning equipment, which is constantly in use. Even at distances of 20-30 meters, you hear everything. It results in a constant barrage of indistinct sounds that permeate even the saunas. The sleep/silent room is also plagued by the sound of the nearby highway, coupled with ventilation noise, and it is uncomfortably cold. Additionally, it looks like a garage filled with mismatched furniture.

Moreover, the signage is very confusing. Upon entry, you're greeted by a cacophony of screaming children, and due to the poor acoustic design, it is quite painful on the ears. There seems to be a separate spa dressing room, but it's only for members. As a result, you end up walking a significant distance to find an empty dressing room, only to realize you need to wear bathing clothes to access the sauna area. Finding the showers is another challenge, as you must pass two saunas and follow confusing signage. It appears forbidden to use soap in some showers, but later on, you discover another shower area where soap use is presumably allowed.

The shower water seems full of chlorine. My eyes hurt like when i was diving in school pool with open eyes but no goggles. And the lighting is harsh white LED, directly in your face. The overall aesthetic feels like a mix of Soviet and East German influences, devoid of any understanding of rich Russian or European sauna culture. Despite the use of high-end materials, the design lacks coherence. For example, one sauna features a “catwalk” that squeaks and is poorly lit, making you feel uncomfortable under the dim white LED light while others stare at you. I normally don't mind being naked in public spaces, but this place made me feel very self-conscious and uncomfortable.

Some vending machines with dry salads and no cutlery to top it off.

I believe some plants, wooden room dividers, and a separate dressing room could significantly improve the atmosphere. It needs a touch of warmth and thoughtful design. As it stands, I left with more stress and less money. And I am not typically a complaining type.

Save your time and money and go somewhere else to recharge. If you really must go I highly recommend you take earplugs and shades/sleep masks with you.

It is an amazing place with tons of options for both kids and adults. There’s fresh water and saline water pools, warm (30-35c) or cold (18c) options. Lots of play toys for everyone, including a huge inflated floating island and a massive tube slide that’s 3 stories tall. The place is extremely clean and people are just so nice and courteous. We went while on vacation in Bern and the kids just needed a nice fun break from sightseeing.
Yes, they sell swimsuits right there for those that didn’t think to pack one on a December trip to Switzerland :)
Overall highly recommend the place for a fun relaxing non-touristy activity especially for the kids!

It’s ok and clean because it’s quite new. It’s much smaller than alpamare in pfäffikon. This one has three slides and a wild water slide. Alpamare has at least twice as many, more outdoor pools, a wave pool etc. so alpamare is a lot more fun than this one. But this one is nice for what it is. Also, when we were there, it felt really full and we had to wait nearly 15min to go down a slide. When we left (attendance was still increasing), the website showed 60% full. But it really felt like 100% full already
Had a wonderful time with the kids. The staff is so friendly and well intentioned. Very diverse and balanced water park mixing leisure and relaxation to the perfection.

Unsatisfied experience at Mobilezone

I recently had an extremely unsatisfactory experience at Mobilezone. I originally planned to get a mobile phone subscription, but the advice I received left a bitter aftertaste.

The salesperson suggested changing my internet provider from UPC to Sunrise as my promotion with UPC was expiring. He assured me that this would save me the 54 CHF for the cell phone deposit. He also promised me “free” headphones and a phone case for half the price. I confidently accepted this offer.

However, after I contacted UPC back home, they offered to extend the promotion for another 2 years, which was clearly a better offer than Sunrise's. When I tried to cancel the migration, the salesperson said he would discuss it with his colleague and call me back the next day. That callback never came.

Frustrated by the lack of communication, I went back to the store to ask. The seller's response was simply disappointing: "Been busy." When I tried to cancel the migration again, I was suddenly charged a fee of 150 CHF. I was informed that if I wanted to cancel this fee would be applied to the supposedly "free" headphones, phone case and cell phone.

Ultimately, I was forced to contact Sunrise directly to cancel the migration, which involved additional time and inconvenience. This experience not only cost me money, but also valuable time and nerves. I am extremely disappointed by the lack of transparency and unfair treatment by Mobilezone.
Top customer service! I have been visiting this branch for years. Questions are answered competently and friendly. I can recommend this branch 100%.
